subject: Productivity
title: Sunk Cost and Goal Persistence
description: A fast breakdown of Sunk Cost and Goal Persistence for builders.

hook.text: You've trained for a marathon for six months. Your knee hurts. Do you run anyway? Most people do.

buildup.text: The sunk cost fallacy makes people continue pursuing goals because of what they've already invested.

discovery.text: Rational goal pursuit means evaluating goals by future value, not past investment.

twist.text: Quitting a goal feels like failure. But strategic quitting is a skill. Winners quit the right things.

climax.text: Seth Godin argues that knowing when to quit is as important as knowing when to persevere.

punchline.text: Sometimes the bravest goal move is letting one go.

quiz.question: What is the sunk cost fallacy in goal pursuit?
options: Continuing a goal because of past investment rather than future value
Setting too many goals at once
